Job Title: Field Applications Specialist- MD - Virginia

Location: Virginia, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Customer Service

Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Field Applications Specialist - Molecular Diagnostics

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

Roche Support Network offers an exciting opportunity for individuals who are passionate about problem solving. As a research-focused healthcare company, Roche is dedicated to discovering, developing, and providing innovative diagnostics and therapeutic products. With a commitment to employee development and a work environment that values respect and empowerment, Roche offers exciting career prospects for those seeking to make a significant impact on patient care.

Your Opportunity

Roche Support Network is dedicated to providing exceptional support to customersAs a Field Applications Specialist, you will travel to demonstrate your expertise in technical repair and installation for Roche product linesYou will serve as the primary liaison and expert for consultative, administrative, and technical installation mattersAs the lead technical expert, you will support the local support team in identifying, analyzing, and executing complex hardware instrument implementations. You will diagnose and resolve mechanical, hardware, software, and system failures while minimizing installation delaysMaximizing customer satisfaction with Roche installations and promoting effective communication within the team are key responsibilitiesYou will oversee and assess the quality of installation teams' work and provide feedback for improvement

This is a field based role - The territory is all of VA with travel to Memphis, TN 15% of the time. The ideal candidate will be located in VA.

Who You Are

Bachelor’s degree in Biology, Chemistry, Cell Biology or Biochemistry, or Bachelor’s degree in Medical Technology, and/or relevant experience3 years of previous experience in a clinical laboratory or IT in a clinical lab environment


Preferred
Demonstrated ability to learn and stay updated on Roche solutions across various fields, including chemistry, immunology, molecular, life sciences, and IT solutions, while keeping up with industry trendsEffective written and verbal communication skills, along with project management experienceStrong customer consultative skills, including advanced scientific knowledge, exceptional customer engagement, and the ability to foster strong customer relationships. Additionally, the ability to coach and mentor junior staff and work independently as a field-based individual contributor

Relocation benefits are not available for this position.

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

As a global leader in healthcare, Roche Diagnostics offers a broad portfolio of products, tools and services that help in the prevention, diagnosis and management of diseases like HPV, HIV, hepatitis and diabetes as well as other medical conditions, such as fertility and blood coagulation. These products and services are used by researchers, physicians, patients, hospitals and laboratories worldwide to help improve people's lives.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
